title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 26 September 2012 - XWiki
content:

10:10 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:56 <jvdrean1> has joined #xwiki  
10:58 <jvdrean> has quit  
11:15 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
11:21 <+sburjan> tmortagne: I'm going to test your last commit, about UI merge in XE  
11:22 <+tmortagne> sburjan: not sure what you are talking about  
11:23 <+tmortagne> my last commit is about some API of the installer that nobody is using yet  
11:23 <+sburjan> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/a3b4c884095fd11342c43599322e18c93d4de8af  
11:24 <+tmortagne> sburjan: that's a branch  
11:24 <+tmortagne> and a work in progress  
11:24 <+tmortagne> for 4.3  
11:24 <+sburjan> yes, I've missed the branch. sorry  
11:24 <+sburjan> i didn't look at what branch it was on :)  
11:25 <+tmortagne> sburjan: I will close the jira issue as soon as it's ok for you to test so better following jira that the github mail for this  
11:25 <+sburjan> ok. thanks for the tip  
11:29 <vmassol> has quit  
11:39 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
11:51 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
11:51 <jvdrean1> has quit

11:56 <Guest75446> is now known as <cjd\_>  
12:06 <mflorea> has quit  
12:21 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
13:26 <jvelo> Hi guys.  
13:27 <jvelo> I see two functionnal test artifacts that are failing on CI  
13:27 <jvelo> xwiki-enterprise-test-extension and xwiki-enterprise-test-ui-IE8  
13:30 <vmassol1> jvelo: I don't think we're taking much care of the IE8 tests at this point, sburjan would know better  
13:30 <jvelo> hum, is it normal there is no builds for stable-4.2 yet on jenkins ?  
13:30 <vmassol1> no idea, I haven't followed that, Enygma` should know  
13:30 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
13:31 <jvelo> because now master is 4.3-SNAPSHOT  
13:31 <vmassol> yes  
13:31 <vmassol> you need to release from stable branch  
13:31 <jvelo> and platform is failing to build it seems : http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Platform/job/xwiki-platform/  
13:31 <vmassol> this is master  
13:32 <vmassol> I think Enygma` was following the platform build failure on master  
13:32 <+sburjan> vmassol:, jvelo : there is something with the Jenkins agent. Bot IE8 and IE9 tests hang. The xwiki instance is shutdown before all the tests get to run  
13:32 <+sburjan> I have tried several things, but without success  
13:32 <jvelo> vmassol: yes that's why I asked if we shouldn't have builds for 4.2.x at this point  
13:36 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:42 <+tmortagne> jvelo: Enygma`is creating (or created maybe already) the 4.2 jobs  
13:42 <+Enygma`> jvelo: I`ve noticed the lack of -4.2 jobs today and will create them. This part was not documented in the release plan/help.  
13:42 <+Enygma`> re the platform failure, we should investigate that better  
13:42 <+Enygma`> I think we have a problem in the build  
13:43 <+Enygma`> when we have a new version, test-jars are not found and the build fails  
13:43 <vmassol> Enygma`: can you reproduce by cleaning your ocal repo and building with -o?  
13:44 <jvelo> Enygma`: ok thanks for the update  
13:50 <+Enygma`> vmassol: trying to reproduce locally by using a clean local repository and building only xwiki-platform-extension-script  
13:56 <jvelo> guys, vmassol . release notes for a final version is recap of all milestones and RCs, right? Should I copy over feature descriptions, or do we edit new summaries for each features ?  
13:56 <vmassol> jvelo: copy  
13:56 <jvelo> OK  
13:56 <vmassol> yes it's a recap  
13:56 <vmassol> that we build by copying and aggregating  
13:57 <vmassol> if things are not that important you can move them to Miscellaneous  
13:57 <vmassol> they could have been important for a release beciuase there was not much else done… and not that important for the overall RN for a release ;)  
13:57 <vmassol> but you can just do the aggreation and we can review toegther  
13:57 <jvelo> yep  
13:57 <jvelo> and consolidate when a feature is spread accross releases etc.  
13:57 <jvelo> ok  
14:13 <+Enygma`> vmassol: can`t reproduce it locally using the mentioned method. Well, the tests froze due to a ConcurrentModificationException, but tmortagne knows about that.  
14:13 <+sburjan> quick question: is it normal to get the distribution wizard when performing a migration ?  
14:14 <+tmortagne> sburjan: that's the idea yes, you cange the WAR so you need to install the corresponding XAR  
14:14 <+tmortagne> s/cange/changed/  
14:15 <+sburjan> I see.  
14:15 <+tmortagne> it's actually the main goal  
14:15 <jvelo> Enygma`: can you create the jobs for 4.2 ?  
14:15 <+tmortagne> the install one was more bonus  
14:16 <+Enygma`> jvelo: doing this now, but it will take a bit due to the tricky dependencies between jobs and the fact that Jenkins insists that there are no non-existing jobs referenced... so it's twice the work :)  
14:18 <jvelo> Enygma`: OK. thanks  
14:29 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:31 <jvelo> sdumitriu: Hi, can you allow my PURL user (jvelociter) to create RN links ? Thanks  
14:37 <+sburjan> guys, lease take a look at this. it might be serious  
14:37 <+sburjan> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8252  
14:38 <+tmortagne> checking  
14:41 <+sburjan> it's like everything we fixed since 3.3.1 I can see it as a conflict between 3.3.1 and 4.2-RC1  
14:41 <+tmortagne> sburjan: wait I did  not see it was 3.3.1  
14:42 <+tmortagne> so you did not installed the previous version with EM or the Wizard ?  
14:42 <+sburjan> no  
14:42 <+tmortagne> ho so that's whay  
14:42 <+tmortagne> why  
14:42 <+tmortagne> EM does not have any idea what you have in your wiki  
14:42 <+sburjan> i have a 3.3.1 installed the old way, by importing the XAR raditionally.  
14:43 <+tmortagne> it does not know it's 3.3.1 or even what is it  
14:43 <+tmortagne> so there is no way for it to compare  
14:43 <+sburjan> well if someone wants to migrate from 2.7 or 3.1 . he will get tons of these  
14:43 <+tmortagne> that's the main goal for displaying the Wyzard t install: make sure the UI is installed trough EM so that we know what is installed  
14:44 <+tmortagne> sburjan: yes  
14:44 <+sburjan> but it's not ok. I've spent 10 minutes clicking n continue. And still clicking  
14:45 <+sburjan> this makes the distribution wizard a true pain  
14:45 <+tmortagne> that's because there is a lot of differences between 3.3.1 and 4.2 snapshot  
14:45 <+tmortagne> the plan for this is to allow the user to indicate what is the currently installed UI  
14:45 <+tmortagne> but we did not had time to do it in the UI  
14:45 <vmassol> ok so it means we cannot recommend upgrading to 4.2 :(  
14:45 <+sburjan> yes. but the users won't care. they will say something is bad because they have to spend 15 minutes clicking continue  
14:45 <vmassol> +1 sburjan  
14:46 <+sburjan> vmassol: surely not.  
14:47 <vmassol> this will need to be added in big bold red letters in the 4.2RC1 and 4.2 final release notes  
14:48 <vmassol> ie that it should be used if not upgrading only or otherwise you'll have to spend time merging all differences that happened between your version and 4.2  
14:48 <vmassol> actually  
14:49 <vmassol> the comment should specify that the user can still upgrade by choosing skip and doing an import as before  
14:49 <vmassol> and the comment should reference the JIRA issue to fix this  
14:49 <+tmortagne> not skip, cancel  
14:49 <vmassol> yes cancel  
14:52 <+sburjan> ok. after 20 minutes of clicking, I'm done :)  
14:56 <+sburjan> question: doing this, and importing the XAR old school, won't prologue the issue to oher versions ? because Em still won't be aware of what is installed.  
14:56 <+tmortagne> sburjan: yes  
14:57 <+tmortagne> well  
14:57 <+tmortagne> not exactly actually  
14:57 <+tmortagne> since there is a hack in the standard importer to register as extension the imported XAR  
14:58 <+tmortagne> so it will be ui-all instead of ui but EM will know what's installed  
14:58 <+sburjan> oh cool. so we import the xar old method and the xwiki will see it as instaled via EM ?  
14:58 <+sburjan> ok, that's cool  
14:58 <vmassol> no  
14:58 <+tmortagne> and since ui-all declare ui and all its dependencies as virtual ids it will be found as previous version of ui-all  
14:59 <+tmortagne> vmassol: what no ?  
14:59 <vmassol> "EM will know what's installed"  
14:59 <vmassol> if you install with import EM will not know, right?  
14:59 <+tmortagne> I just explained why it will know it  
14:59 <+tmortagne> that's the vote I sent recently to put the extension id in the poackage.xml  
15:00 <vmassol> ok that's cool didn't realize it has this effect  
15:01 <+tmortagne> note: only if you have access to the repository while importing the XAR  
15:01 <+sburjan> so importing the xar in 4.2 using the old way, will make EM aware of the extensions installed, so for future versions Distro Wizard won't see many conflicts. Did I understood properly ?  
15:02 <+tmortagne> it's a bit complex to upgrade from ui-all to ui and has to be well tested but in theory yes  
15:02 <+mflorea> guys, it seems that the export and print preview features don't preserve the query string of the document. This means that dynamic documents whose output is different based on some query string parameters are not properly exported. I view this as a bug and I want to check if this is by design (i.e. you could say that the document from the db is printed, not the one modified by the query string). WDYT?  
15:03 <+sburjan> tmortagne: I understand. But ATM this can't be tested because we have no 4.3. Right ?  
15:04 <+tmortagne> mflorea: AFAIK the way export work is not really by exporting the current document but what to export is listed in the query string and the export action is called  
15:06 <+tmortagne> sburjan: actually there is several way to test  
15:06 <+tmortagne> \* the quickest is to add a descriptor by hand in the EM index  
15:07 <+tmortagne> and restart  
15:07 <+tmortagne> for example in your case you add the 3.3.1 ui-all to the EM index  
15:08 <+mflorea> tmortagne: I'm talking no single page export, in which case the only required export query string is "format=foo". Ofc, adding the document query string to the export query string results in a proper export  
15:08 <+mflorea> s/no/about  
15:08 <+sburjan> so in 4.2-rc1 i add the 3.3.1 ui-all descriptor in EM ? (before using the distro wizard) ?  
15:08 <+tmortagne> mflorea: actually depends what export we were talking about  
15:08 <+tmortagne> I was talking about html one  
15:08 <+tmortagne> sburjan: for example yes  
15:10 <+sburjan> this means that Distro Wizard won't work well until the user imports the XAR using the old method ?  
15:10 <+tmortagne> the Wizard will not be able to to 3 way merge until it knows what's installed already  
15:11 <+sburjan> ouch. this will hurt  
15:11 <+mflorea> tmortagne: it doesn't matter the export type. As long as it's a single page export, adding the document query string to the export query string works fine.  
15:12 <+sburjan> it adds onemore step to the migration process  
15:12 <+tmortagne> sburjan: not if we add right in the UI a way to indicate what's currently installed  
15:13 <+tmortagne> in the Wizard  
15:13 <+tmortagne> we already talked about that with mflorea  but we were too short for 4.2  
15:13 <+mflorea> sburjan: it's a work in progress, the first version  
15:14 <+sburjan> tmortagne: yes, but before we indicate what's curently installed we have to import the xar old way to make the EM aware of what is installed, righ ?  (vote about vote sent recently to put the extension id in the poackage.xml)  
15:17 <+tmortagne> sburjan: "the quickest is to add a descriptor by hand in the EM index"  
15:17 <+tmortagne> we would simply do pretty much that in the Wizard  
15:32 <+sburjan> does postgres support XEM ?  
15:33 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
15:33 <evalica> has quit  
15:33 <evalica1> is now known as <evalica>  
15:42 <+sburjan> Enygma`: I get error s when trying to install Workspaces on a postgres instance. is postgres supported ? I tested on 3.3.1 and on 4.2 RC1  
15:43 <+Enygma`> workspaces is just a collection of UIs and scripts, it should not impact XE/XEM at a database level.  
15:44 <+Enygma`> can you give us more details on those errors?  
15:48 <+Enygma`> jvelo: done. I`ve launched a build of xwiki-commons-4.2 that should trigger all the rest  
15:49 <+sburjan> Enygma`: just a second  
15:50 <jvelo> Enygma`: OK great. Thanks for this  
15:51 <+tmortagne> sburjan: no creating a wiki is not fully supported with pgsql  
15:52 <+tmortagne> but you can use pgsql if you create the actual databases yourself  
15:52 <+tmortagne> AFAIK  
15:52 <+tmortagne> in any case you don't have to test it  
15:53 <+tmortagne> the only thing officially supported in virtual mode in MySQL  
15:53 <+tmortagne> maybe Oracle I'm not sure  
15:53 <+sburjan> getting a stack in 5 minz  
15:53 <+tmortagne> sburjan: see jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-1960  
15:56 <+sburjan> thanks  
15:56 <+sburjan> i was thinking only oracle doesn't support XEM  
15:59 <+sburjan> Enygma`: http://pastebin.com/8ruC8MQf. But as tmortagne said, i guess this is normal  
16:03 <+Enygma`> sburjan: that looks weird... the error message is more or less messed up since it's like activity stream failed, but I guess it`s related to what tmortagne mentioned since it fails at saving a document inside the new wiki template.  
16:32 <jvelo> Enygma`: is it me or the build of commons hasn't triggered rendering, etc. ?  
16:35 <+Enygma`> jvelo: looking into it  
16:42 <+Enygma`> it should have been triggered  
16:42 <+Enygma`> the -4.2 jobs have exactly the same configuration as the ones for master  
16:43 <+Enygma`> and, for example, rendering has checked the option "Build whenever a SNAPSHOT dependency is built"  
16:43 <+Enygma`> so after a build of commons, it should have been triggered  
16:43 <+Enygma`> so I`m a bit puzzled  
16:52 <jvelo> Enygma`: strange..  
16:52 <+Enygma`> all the configuration seems to be right  
16:53 <+Enygma`> and now strangely a build was triggered for xwiki-platform-4.2 because of a commit on stable-4.2.x from 6 hours ago...  
16:54 <+Enygma`> vmassol: could you please have a quick look over the -4.2 jobs to see if you spot a problem?  
16:55 <+Enygma`> specifically why did not xwiki-rendering-4.2 get triggered once xwiki-commons-4.2 finished.  
17:17 <jvelo> should we trigger rendering manually for now ?  
17:20 <+tmortagne> jvelo, Enygma`: it did not triggered it because rendering does not know it depends on commons- 4.2  
17:20 <+tmortagne> and that's because it has never been built  
17:20 <jvelo> hehe  
17:20 <jvelo> OK  
17:20 <+tmortagne> so it did not parsed the maven informations  
17:21 <jvelo> I guess it does that for platform as well ?  
17:21 <+tmortagne> probably  
17:21 <jvelo> it means we need to trigger all TLP manually the first time ?  
17:21 <+tmortagne> except that someone started it it seems  
17:22 <+tmortagne> jvelo: I guess  
17:22 <+tmortagne> I don't see how jenkins could know the ids without doing a git clone  
17:23 <+tmortagne> there is something weird in the rendering configuration fail  
17:23 <+tmortagne> it gives an error  
17:24 <+tmortagne> http://jenkins.xwiki.org/view/Rendering/job/xwiki-rendering-4.2/configure  
17:24 <+tmortagne> "Failed  to connect to repository : Error performing command: /usr/bin/git  ls-remote -h git://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering.git HEAD"  
17:24 <+tmortagne> maybe it's able to find it itself actually  
17:24 <+tmortagne> but since it could not check the repository...  
17:26 <+tmortagne> does someone see anything wrong in this repository ?  
17:27 <+tmortagne> commons produces the same error actually  
17:29 <+Enygma`> tmortagne: AFAIK, all jobs have that error listed  
17:29 <+tmortagne> that's new  
17:29 <+Enygma`> but they work  
17:29 <+tmortagne> first time I see this error  
17:29 <+Enygma`> it`s like this since 2 weeks  
17:30 <+tmortagne> 2 weeks is not that long :)  
17:31 <+Enygma`> so to make sure I understand the triggering issue: all top level projects (at least commons, rendering, platform enterprise and manager) need to be manually triggered the first time after the branch has been changed in the configuration?  
17:31 <+Enygma`> to make sure they do a git pull on the newly configured branch?  
17:32 <silviar> has quit  
17:32 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: the issue is that they don't have any ide on which job they depends until they know what they are  
17:32 <+tmortagne> and for that they need to check the pom.xml files  
17:33 <+tmortagne> maybe they automatically to a remote check of the pom.xml but it seems to fail  
17:34 <+tmortagne> so we have to either commit something or force the build  
17:34 <+Enygma`> right... seems reasonable :)  
17:34 <+Enygma`> thanks for the info :)  
17:35 <+tmortagne> did we upgraded the git/github plugin recently to cause this error ?  
17:35 <+Enygma`> I would not know that...  
17:36 <+tmortagne> looks like we are fully up to date  
17:37 <+tmortagne> I just tried this command and it works well for me  
17:37 <+tmortagne> not sure why it fail on jenkins  
17:37 <+tmortagne> maybe git is too old  
17:38 <+tmortagne> actually there is no git on root jenkins...  
17:38 <+tmortagne> that's probably why  
17:38 <+tmortagne> so it's probably a new feature  
17:40 <+tmortagne> fixed  
18:00 <+tmortagne> XWiki debian repository is now properly GPG signed ;)  
18:11 <cjd\_> jvelo: are you branching 4.2.x for 4.2.0? is stable-4.2.x ok to commit on for 4.2.1 ?  
18:13 <jvelo> cjd\_: I haven't branched 4.2.x  
18:13 <jvelo> but I can do it  
18:14 <jvelo> actually the release plan does not mention anything about release branches  
18:15 <vmassol> has quit  
18:15 <jvelo> are we doing it usually ?  
18:15 <jvdrean> has quit  
18:16 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
18:16 <cjd\_> has quit  
18:16 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
18:17 <cjd\_> has joined #xwiki  
18:19 <+Enygma`> jvelo: the release scripts take each project at a time, pull the sources and create a temporary local release branch. It would be nice if they would first do this temporary local release branch step for \*all\* the projects and then proceed with the building. This way devs would not have to wait for the release to finish in order to start committing.  
18:20 <jvelo> OK  
18:20 <jvelo> I see  
18:20 <+Enygma`> but until then, if you want to do branching, you have to do it manually or modify the scripts...  
18:21 <jvelo> cjd\_: can you wait a bit or do you want me to branch right now ?  
18:21 <+tmortagne> jvelo: no usually we don't  
18:21 <+tmortagne> (create release branches)  
18:21 <cjd\_> it's fine with me  
18:22 <cjd\_> I'll just make a mental note to backport that at some point  
18:26 <jvelo> cjd\_: OK  
18:27 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:28 <Enygma`> has quit  
18:38 <jvelo> platform 4.2 build failed with "could not find artifact org.xwiki.commons:xwiki-commons-extension-api:jar:tests:4.2-SNAPSHOT"  
18:38 <jvelo> though I can find a tests SNAPSHOT in http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/commons/xwiki-commons-extension-api/4.2-SNAPSHOT/  
18:54 <evalica> has quit  
19:05 <Denis> has quit  
19:08 <jvdrean> has quit  
19:17 <vmassol> has quit  
19:20 <coud3> has quit  
19:24 <coud3> has joined #xwiki  
19:32 <coud4> has joined #xwiki  
19:33 <coud3> has quit  
19:39 <coud4> has quit  
19:42 <coud4> has joined #xwiki  
19:56 <mflorea> has quit  
20:56 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
21:25 <polx> has quit  
21:25 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
21:26 <vmassol> has quit  
21:40 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
21:42 <+sburjan> I wonder if it is feasible if we start building packages for all supported database  
21:43 <vmassol> you mean VMs?  
21:43 <+sburjan> no, builds like we have XEM with MySQL, and so on  
21:43 <+sburjan> XE + postgres  
21:43 <vmassol> we don't package mysql
